title: US Education Dept opens probe into Harvard’s legacy admissions
description: A complaint earlier this month triggered the investigation, which will consider whether the practice is discriminatory.

title: Mexican armed forces facilitated Ayotzinapa disappearances: Panel
description: An independent investigatory panel says security forces obstructed their efforts to investigate human rights scandal.

title: Photos: Wildfires ravage Greece, Italy as Mediterranean swelters
description: High temperatures and parched ground have sparked wildfires in countries on both sides of the Mediterranean.

title: Al Jazeera slams naming of its journalists on Egypt ‘terror’ list
description: Al Jazeera Media Network denounces the Egyptian move to reinstate a number of its journalists on 'terror' list.

title: UK warns Russia may begin targeting civilian ships in Black Sea
description: UK ambassador to the UN says the 'Russian military may expand their targeting of Ukrainian grain facilities further'.

title: Guatemala voters voice uncertainty ahead of presidential run-off
description: Observers fear interference in the final leg of the presidential race, as prosecutors target one of the leading parties.

title: Kenya’s Ruto offers to meet leader of opposition protests
description: Opposition leader Raila Odinga has accused police of using violence against demonstrators.

title: Internet ban partially lifted in India’s violence-hit Manipur
description: State lifts ban on wired broadband internet but social media websites, VPNS and mobile hotspots remain inaccessible.

title: US judge blocks Biden’s ‘asylum ban’ at Mexico border

title: Is Israel being torn apart by law that weakens the Supreme Court?
description: Months of mass demonstrations fail to stop the far-right government from limiting the judiciary's independence.

title: Belgian court convicts suspects over role in 2016 Brussels attack
description: Six men have been convicted for two coordinated attacks claimed by ISIL that shook Belgium's capital.

title: Photos: Monument cements Emmett Till case as ‘an American story’
description: The Black teenager's killing in Mississippi in 1955 helped propel the US civil rights movement.

title: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur handed two-match ban for outburst
description: Kaur was reprimanded for smashing the wickets after her dismissal and terming the umpiring 'pathetic'.

title: Ecuador declares state of emergency in prisons amid fatal attacks
description: President Guillermo Lasso orders military and police to take control of Ecuador's prison system after wave of violence.

title: Wang Yi replaces Qin Gang as Chinese FM: What to know
description: Qin Gang's removal is seen as an 'enormous shock' as the Chinese government reappoints Wang Yi to the post he once held.

title: What’s next for Israel after Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul bill?
description: The new law limiting the powers of the judiciary is not irreversible, but the path ahead is uncertain.

title: Biden honours Emmett Till, his mother with US national monument
description: The 1955 lynching of Till, a Black teen, and his mother's subsequent activism helped propel US civil rights movement.

title: Will Egypt’s asset sale get it out of its economic hole?
description: Egypt is privatising - but is it enough to please the IMF and get more funding from the international financial body?

title: Qurans burned outside Egyptian, Turkish embassies in Denmark

title: Tunisia protest marks two years since president’s power grab
description: Opposition has kept up its demonstrations against what it calls a 'coup' against Tunisia's democracy.

title: UN starts moving oil from Yemen tanker in bid to stop disaster

title: US says Russian aircraft struck its drone with flare over Syria
description: Incident is latest in a series of recent encounters involving Russian fighter jets and US drones flying over Syria.

title: Firefighting plane crashes in Greece as wildfires rage

title: A traumatised father battles Russia on Ukraine’s front line
description: Losses in east Ukraine are felt by soldiers and civilians alike. For many, nothing remains of their homes but memories.

title: Peru’s cocaine trade overruns remote Indigenous territory
description: As coca production surges, Indigenous communities in Peru fear addiction and violence are encroaching on their lands.

title: Suspended Nigerian central bank governor denies firearm charges
description: The central bank chief, Nigeria's longest-serving, has been suspended since June 10 and in state custody.

title: Ruto unmasked: Breaking the rules of Kenya’s game of thrones

title: China’s Foreign Minister Qin Gang removed from office
description: Announcement by state media comes a month after Qin Gang's last public appearance.

title: Wildfire closes Sicily airport; storms kill two in northern Italy
